meanings.definition: Something added to fill a space or add bulk.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used wood filler to fix the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The pillow was stuffed with filler to make it plump and comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much filler to the soup, making it too thick.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a filler, filling the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The student used filler in the essay to meet the word count requirement.

meanings.definition: A substance used to fill cracks or holes.
meanings.sent1: The painter used filler to patch up the cracks in the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The handyman applied filler to the wall to cover up the holes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the filler to hide its acorns in the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The music was a filler for the silence in the room, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The baker used filler to create a smooth surface on the cake.

meanings.definition: A material used to add weight or volume to something.
meanings.sent1: The lifter added filler to the barbell to increase the weight.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed filler into the paint to give it a thicker consistency.
meanings.sent3: The balloon popped when too much filler was added, making it too heavy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a filler that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used filler to make the soil more fertile for the plants.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that fills a vacancy or completes a group.
meanings.sent1: The substitute teacher was a filler for the regular teacher who was sick.
meanings.sent2: The missing puzzle piece was the perfect filler to complete the picture.
meanings.sent3: The extra player was a filler in the soccer match, making the teams even.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a filler that brought the community together.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was a great filler for the team, adding valuable skills.
